content: capacity from one site to another by using the Flexible Capacity features of the IBM z16. A Flexible Capacity record is installed on the machines at each site. The machine at Site A has the base capacity that is configured at the same level as the high water mark of the Site B machine and has flex capacity that is activated to its HWM. The flex capacity is then added to the machine at Site B, which brings it up to the Site A HWM and workload is transferred. After all workload is transferred (within 24 hours), the capacity of the Site A machine is reduced to the base level. Workload can continue to run at Site B for up to a year. Chapter 8.
